parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering hose can cause a loss of power steering fluid, leading to a loss of power steering assist, making it difficult to control the vehicle, and potentially causing an accident.
symptoms: Power steering fluid leaking at the connector clamp seal
power steering fluid dripping onto the hot exhaust manifold

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The brake issues reported can cause a loss of control, increasing the risk of an accident.
The transmission failure reported can cause a loss of control, increasing the risk of an accident.
The radiator hose failure reported can cause engine overheating, leading to engine damage or failure.
symptoms: Radiator hose melts due to close proximity to manifold.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The window fogging reported can cause reduced visibility, increasing the risk of an accident.
The failure of the engine timing belt can cause the engine to stall or lose power, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing accidents, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The vehicle experiences a complete loss of acceleration and power
and the vehicle will not start.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Intermittent stalling can cause the vehicle to lose power and control, leading to accidents, especially in heavy traffic or at high speeds.
symptoms: The vehicle stops by itself while being driven
and then all electrical lights come on
and the vehicle stops and will not start.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the drive belt can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage and potentially causing accidents.
The failure of the water pump can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: The water pump needs to be replaced.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the radiator can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: The radiator needs to be replaced.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front seat belt buckle can lead to unexpected release of the buckle, compromising the safety of the driver and passenger in the event of an accident or sudden stop.
symptoms: The buckle appears to engage but releases unexpectedly when pressure is applied to the belt
the buckle releases from the latch when yanked
the release buttons on the belts are cracked and broken
the buckle comes loose from the latch.
